Posts.Content: After 2 mamograms showing microcalcifications, & a stereotactic biopsy with results of atypical cells, I recently had surgery to remove the questionable cells from my left breast. I was diagnosed with DCIS, micro papillary. He said the size was 1.2 cm. The surgeon wants to go back in to remove more tissue until he gets a clear margin. He wants to wait a few weeks to give me time to heal from the previous surgery & speak with a radiologist in regards to whether radiation is necessary. He also wants to start me on Tamoxifen. All of the researching I have been doing online suggests 2 options; additional surgery w/ radiation or mastectomy. From what I've read, radiation is almost always done except after the mastectomy. My surgeon has also suggested that after our next meeting I listen to his game plan & then go see another breast specialist or an oncologist for a second or third opinion so I can weigh all of my options & make a decision that I am comfortable with. Can anyone please share your experience with me? Sometimes I'm leaning toward just removing the additional tissue & keeping my fingers crossed for future mamograms & other times I think maybe it would be best to just have the whole breast removed so there is no chance for the cancer to come back. Any advise would be greatly appreciated!
Posts.Title: DCIS questions
